Class Solution

java.lang.Object
Solution
public class Solution extends Object
The Solution class represents a solution to the problem of allocating projects to students. It uses a greedy and backtracking approach to assign projects to students based on their preferences and the availability of projects proposed by teachers.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Solution(Problem problem)
    Constructs a new Solution object for the specified problem.

    Initializes the solution by populating the available projects and resetting the check array.

  • Constructor Details

    • Solution

      public Solution(Problem problem)
      Constructs a new Solution object for the specified problem. Initializes the arrays for tracking project allocations and project availability.
      Parameters:
      problem - The problem instance containing students, teachers, and projects

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the solution by populating the available projects and resetting the check array.

    • allocateProjects

      public boolean allocateProjects(int studentIndex)
      Attempts to allocate projects to students starting from the given student index using backtracking. If all students are successfully allocated a project, it returns true.
      Parameters:
      studentIndex - The index of the student to allocate a project to
      Returns:
      true if all students have been allocated a project, false otherwise

    • solve

      public void solve()
      Solves the problem of allocating projects to all students by calling the allocateProjects method. If no allocation is found, it prints "No allocation found".

    • printAllocations

      public void printAllocations()
